subject: [Radiance-general] Desktop Radiance installation
body:
Dear Mahbub,

first of all, it is a bit rude to copy an email that is supposed to be
distributed by a mailing list to all the subscribers of the list as a
private email. It is easy to figure out that this means that any of
these subscribers get your email twice, which does not add on to the
information in it but to some demotivation to reply.

Still, to give you a start, as far as I know Desktop Radiance is an old
software that has not been maintained for a while. On this list, you
will most probably not find anyone using it. So I would strongly
recommend against using Desktop Radiance. If you decide still to do so,
and if you are aware of the limitations and probably bugs in that old
code, please mind that this is not a list supporting Desktop Radiance.
Basically it means that you are on your own then. If you want to use
Radiance, get the latest version (which is 4.0, but 3.9 is coming with
lots of distributions and fine to use), read the documentation and ask
when there are open questions.

Regards

Lars O. Grobe.
